History

In 1977, Ben Cohen and Jerry Greenfield completed a course on ice cream making at Pennsylvania State University. On May 5, 1978, they opened their first ice cream shop in a gas station in Burlington, Vermont.

Flavors and Sizes

You can get Ben and Jerry's ice cream in pints, pint slices, non-dairy pints, scoop shop flavors, frozen yogurt pints, mini cups, and quarts. Their top flavors include Half Baked, Cherry Garcia, Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, and Chocolate Fudge Brownie.

Flavor Graveyard

Rest in peace to the flavors that are no longer with us: Schweedy Balls, Wavy Gravy, Fossil Fuel, and Turtle Soup.

Locations

Ben & Jerry's has shops all over the world, including Austria, Australia, Belgium, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Malta, Mexico, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Singapore, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, Turkey, United Kingdom, and the United States.
